headline.main: Knox Says Bougainville Landing Caught Japanese Fully Unaware; Doubts Enemy Was Prepared to Meet Attack by Marines -- Dares Tokyo's Fleet to Come Out to Sea and Fight

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 -- In exultant mood, Frank Knox, Secretary of the Navy, said today that the landings of the United States Marines on Bougainville Island had caught the Japanese completely unaware. The operation, said the Secretary at a press conference, had been so carefully planned "without leaks" that the enemy "evidently was not prepared for it."
abstract: On Jap problem in reinforcing garrisons, Southwest Pacific
